page.title: 13FARMING
page.content: The fields, around the crossroads, are rotated between corn and cattle grazing. On the 1 ton road from the crossroads, on the right is a pit dug into the hillside that at one time may have been a quarry or gravel pit but is now just full of rubbish. West of the crossroad on the Tincleton-Dorchester road is a small building on the Ministry of Agriculture land. North of the crossroads is a road leading to{Higher Bockhampton. { }On the left of the crossroad is, marked on an O.S. map, a small bend but this is not evident. Furthe to{Higher Bockhampton}the site of a roman road crosses the road. This is no longer evident but the embankment of the road can be seen in places in{Puddletown Forest.
